intro: Machaeranthera montana, commonly known as mountain bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Machaeranthera montana is known for its delicate appearance and is adapted to harsh alpine environments.
